newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: IRA admits responsibility for motorway bomb.
newsitem.headline: IRA admits responsibility for motorway bomb.

text.p: The IRA on Sunday said it was responsible for a bomb blast near a British motorway on Friday in a call to the Irish Republic's RTE broadcasting network.
Two bombs blew up next to the M6 motorway in central England on Friday. There were no injuries. One blast damaged a 132,000 volt electricity pylon.
The banned Irish Republican Army has mounted several attempts to disrupt Britain's May 1 election campaign by bringing the country's road and railway network to a halt.
The IRA has fought for 25 years to oust British troops from Northern Ireland.
